  • Method Details

    • getTotalExp

      @Query(value="select sum(amount) from purchase where Cast(time as date) between :date1 and :date2", nativeQuery=true) Optional<Double> getTotalExp​(@Param("date1") String date1, @Param("date2") String date2)
      It returns the total amount of money spent on purchases between two dates
      Parameters:
      date1 - The start date of the period
      date2 - The end date of the period you want to get the total expenses for.
      Returns:
      Optional

    • getExpDate

      @Query(value="select Cast(Cast(time as date) as char) as dates, sum(amount) as value from purchase group by dates having dates between :date1 and :date2", nativeQuery=true) List<javax.persistence.Tuple> getExpDate​(@Param("date1") String date1, @Param("date2") String date2)
      It returns a list of tuples, each tuple contains the date and the total amount of purchases made on that date
      Parameters:
      date1 - The start date of the range
      date2 - the end date
      Returns:
      A list of tuples.
